critique: This document pertains to the National Industrial Recovery Act during the Great Depression. It approves modifications to the Code of Fair Competition for the Textile Bag Industry. Given the context of the New Deal, the document likely leans towards government intervention in the economy. There's no direct indication of stances on immigration, executive power, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, or social inclusion. However, the approval of industry-specific codes suggests a centralized approach to economic regulation.
